learning_outcomes.description: Group theory - After completion of this course students should have a solid understanding of the essentials of modern group theory. Topics covered include the three isomorphism theorems, the notion of solvable and simple groups, the JordanHlder theorem and the extension problem.

Ring theory - After completion of this course students should have a solid understanding of basic ring theory. Topics covered include ideals, the characteristic of a ring, the isomorphism theorems for rings, domains and integral domains, fraction fields and unique factorsation domains.

assessments.task_description: There will be 3 assignments, each worth 10%.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: The in-semester exam for this course will be held in week 7 - Wednesday 15 April at 5pm.
assessments.task_description:
The In-Semester exam will be an in-person exam held on campus.

The In-Semester exam will be comprehensive, with all material covered in the lectures and applied classes up to week 6 being examinable, unless explicitly noted in the lectures

(some more advanced topics and extension material will be excluded).

The In-Semester exam will be closed book. No calculators or other aids are allowed. No formula sheets or summary sheets are permitted or provided.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The end of semester examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.

The exam will be comprehensive, with all material covered in the lectures and applied classes from the whole semester being examinable, unless explicitly noted in the lectures

(some more advanced topics and extension material will be excluded).

The exam will be closed book. No calculators or other aids are allowed. No formula sheets or summary sheets are permitted or provided
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture classes

Three traditional black/whiteboard lectures per week. Students are expected to actively participate by taking notes, asking questions, and by answering weekly homework problems.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture classes Three traditional black/whiteboard lectures per week. Students are expected to actively participate by taking notes, asking questions, and by answering weekly homework problems.

learning_activities.topic:
Applied classes

During the applied classes students can work on the assignment problems (some of which are deliberately hard and require assistance from the casual academic).
learning_activities.topic_description: Applied classes During the applied classes students can work on the assignment problems (some of which are deliberately hard and require assistance from the casual academic).
